Text:
President Biden and the Democrats are working to revitalize our manufacturing economy.

The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act, combined with the enacted infrastructure law, would constitute a once in a generation investment in our supply chains, manufacturing, and infrastructure.

I'm pleased @smithsoniannpg is honoring my good friend, John Lewis, in their #OurStruggleForJustice digital collection.

He was a giant among men who embodies this project’s focus on highlighting Americans who devoted their lives to activism and social justice. https://t.co/GLWP5CysNX

I applaud the Biden Admin's steps to hold Vladimir Putin accountable for his escalating aggression against Ukraine.

Putin’s efforts to divide and misinform are not succeeding—we stand united with our allies against his unacceptable attempts to redraw borders by force.

This #PublicSchoolsWeek, I want to thank the teachers and administrators that have kept our public schools running throughout the pandemic.

As a former educator, I'm grateful for their work to create safe and equitable spaces for students to learn during these challenging times. https://t.co/ByMziUHA1h

On this day, I remember my dear friend, John Lewis.
 
Today, on what would have been his 82nd birthday, John’s impact is still felt. We must continue the fight for voting rights in his honor. https://t.co/2oKyeVoBIY
On this President's Day, I commend @POTUS for continuing the work of our greatest presidents, who were committed to making America’s greatness more accessible and affordable for all.

Proud to join the Graham family for the unveiling of the Graham Farm historical marker.

We don’t often learn about the impact the Southern Campaign had on the American Revolution. Landmarks like the Graham Farm ensure we tell that story and teach the full history. https://t.co/R4seI8OfXr

If libraries are centers of learning and truth, librarians are guardians against the misinformation that tears at the fabric of our society.

Check out my #BlackHistoryMonth podcast episode with the first African American @LibnOfCongress, Dr. Carla Hayden.
https://t.co/XG6g0l6s0i

Constance Baker Motley, the 1st Black woman to serve as federal judge, had a key role in implementing laws we rely on today to protect our rights. Today, it was my honor to join with my colleagues to introduce legislation to posthumously award her with a Congressional Gold Medal. https://t.co/6PfVfJmcRC

Oswald Hope Robertson is cited by some as the inventor of the blood bank.

But Dr. Charles Drew, an African American physician, is the inventor of the modern-day blood bank. He developed a method to allow blood to be stored for 2 months. #CriticalRaceFacts https://t.co/we7vZ7DHR4

Pleased to welcome @SecGranholm to @SCSTATE1896 to hear from students at the nation’s only HBCU with a 4-year nuclear engineering program.
 
They'll be critical to filling the clean energy jobs of the future and achieving @POTUS’s goal of growing a diverse, clean energy economy. https://t.co/lEbv21Esto

Today I met with @SecGranholm at @ClemsonUniv's Energy Innovation Center to discuss how facilities like this will help the U.S. meet @POTUS's commitment to deploy 30GW of offshore wind energy by 2030, beat the climate crisis, and bring back American manufacturing jobs. https://t.co/a4M0OV7A2m

Texas’ restrictive voter laws are designed to deny Americans their sacred right to vote.
 
House Democrats have passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act and HR1 to ward off similar attacks happening across the country.
 
It's long past time for the Senate to do its part. https://t.co/es8cJKqO8u

Growing up, my mother instructed me to learn all about South Carolina's Dr. Mary McLeod Bethune. Dr. Bethune was her greatest hero.

I look forward to joining @USRepKCastor when we can finally welcome the statue of her likeness to its final home, the U.S. Capitol. https://t.co/4fBO6ThKmT

After decades of outsourcing, manufacturing jobs are finally returning to American soil.

Since @POTUS took office, South Carolina has added a record 7,200 good-paying manufacturing jobs — helping to restore our nation's rightful place as a leader in innovation and industry. https://t.co/taLyL1pC2c

The fight for voting rights is an "all hands on deck" situation.

The Senate must do its part by passing the For the People Act and the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.

All of us must do our part to protect our democracy.

Thanks to @POTUS and the Infrastructure law, over 10 million households are now connected to school, health care, and more via the Affordable Connectivity Program.
 
Bringing high-speed internet to every American is how we can #BuildBackBetter.
https://t.co/iqlo1noYe5

I want to thank the Felton Laboratory School and the Orangeburg County Library for inviting me to speak on the importance of #BlackHistoryMonth. 
 
We ought to continue to teach our children about the many African American trailblazers who have made this country great. https://t.co/xAU4i9N3Nl

Today we remember the 17 lives lost and many more impacted by the violence at Marjory Stoneman Douglas HS 4 years ago.

I stand with the victims' families and survivors. We must pass common-sense gun legislation to help prevent such a tragedy from happening again. #MSDStrong https://t.co/1BTF8AsIGf

On this day 113 years ago, the @NAACP was founded with the goal of securing for all Americans their Constitutional rights.
 
I commend their continued efforts to make America’s greatness accessible to all of her people.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will create new possibilities for the next generation of HBCU students.

This bill sets aside $1.2 billion to expand research and educational capabilities at our nation's HBCUs and MSIs, ensuring STEM students of color have an equal opportunity to thrive.

This week's #CriticalRaceFact highlights Elijah McCoy.
 
Thomas Savery is known as the inventor of the steam engine. However, Elijah McCoy's automatic oil cup made these engines safer and more efficient.
 
Many tried to copy his work, but most companies wanted "the Real McCoy." https://t.co/vrYvtsD4WE

Having been married to a librarian for 58 years, the profession has been near and dear to me for a very long time.
 
This #BlackHistoryMonth, tune in as I chat with Dr. Carla Hayden, the first woman and African American to lead the @librarycongress.
https://t.co/msuiFXr7e8

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we must raise our voices and fight against the false, politically motivated, narrative about schools teaching critical race theory.
 
As I wrote in @BlackPressUSA, no amount of whitewashing or book banning will change our history.
https://t.co/A8cUIp5Rrl

Today, the House took an important step towards protecting LGBTQI+ communities throughout the world by passing the #GlobalRespectAct. Thank you for your leadership in this effort, @DavidCicilline. https://t.co/lvT90TsNmA

I'd like to remind everyone that "theory" is part of the higher education experience, not K-12.

We ought to be teaching about trailblazing Black Americans.

So, in honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, I shared a few #CriticalRaceFacts on the House floor.
https://t.co/stVmqVjhq7

Americans rely on @USPS to vote, receive social security checks, pay bills, receive medications, and more.
 
The #PostalServiceReform Act of 2022 will address delivery delays and strengthen USPS so Americans can stay connected to the vital services they need.

Partisan actors are seeking to suppress and nullify the votes of the American people, especially people of color.

The right to vote is fundamental. Proud to join @TheBlackCaucus in calling on DOJ to use every tool in its arsenal to protect the franchise.
https://t.co/QBFUZcbZbv

The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act will strengthen our supply chains by lessening our reliance on foreign-made goods and making more products right here on American soil.

This is how we restore American leadership in manufacturing and invest in America’s workers.

The @USDOT RAISE grant program helps transform our communities by improving critical outdated infrastructure.

For information the 2022 RAISE grant program, sign up to attend a free webinar and learn how to compete for this great opportunity.
https://t.co/czuvyjkPqp

Today I join my colleagues in mourning the more than 900,000 American lives lost to COVID-19.

They were loved, and in their absence, countless Americans are mourning their parents, siblings, loved ones and friends.

Help save lives by getting vaccinated and boosted. https://t.co/9uoBwDJ7da

From ride-share apps to corporate workplaces, forced arbitration clauses are hidden in many terms & conditions—silencing sexual assault survivors & emboldening abusers.

The #EndForcedArbitration of Sexual Assault and Sexual Harassment Act will enable survivors to pursue justice.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we ought to reflect on the innumerable contributions of Black women throughout history.

As the first Black woman elected to Congress and the first African American to run for President, Shirley Chisholm's legacy continues to inspire change. https://t.co/5H0FgNkNwq

Thomas Edison is credited with inventing the light bulb, but it's a little known fact the he could not keep the light bulb on.

It was the son of former slaves, Lewis Latimer, of Boston, Massachusetts, who developed the filament that allows light bulbs to work. #CriticalRaceFact https://t.co/5ghHQn6Ogs
Follow along each week, as I discuss a Black American whose contributions changed the direction of our nation. Let’s start with Lewis Latimer.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, let us remember it is not "critical race theory" to learn about the contributions of Black Americans.

We ought not run from our history, but instead embrace the lessons and giants of the past who have helped make our country great.

As we celebrate Rosa Parks' 109th birthday today, we remember her life of service and trailblazing legacy.

Her impact and sacrifices were invaluable to the civil rights movement and the push for racial equality. https://t.co/DXyfDQmFgi

This #WorldCancerDay, I’m grateful that the Biden-Harris Admin is combating cancer by relaunching the Cancer Moonshot.

The Cancer Moonshot will utilize a whole-of-government approach to significantly reduce the cancer death rate and support patients, caregivers & survivors.

“Lift Every Voice and Sing” is a hymn that is so cherished by people of all faiths, creeds, backgrounds, and experiences, that I believe designating it as our “National Hymn” would help unify our nation.

Watch my testimony before @HouseJudiciary. ⬇️ https://t.co/pcFRVS5yNH

As Co-Chair of the Dem Manufacturing Working Group, I'm proud to support the #AmericaCOMPETES Act.

This legislation makes the critical investments in innovation and manufacturing we need to strengthen U.S. supply chains and ensure we can outcompete any nation in the world. https://t.co/busGHoEw1I

It was an honor to help recognize the historic SC Congressman Joseph H. Rainey by dedicating room 150 in the U.S. Capitol in his honor — more than 150 years after his service.

A former slave, he was the first Black man elected to Congress. I proudly stand upon his shoulders. https://t.co/qm8Q4gAYF4

At 9 am tomorrow, I will testify before @HouseJudiciary on my bill to make "Lift Every Voice and Sing" the national hymn.

This song has resonated with me all of my life. Making it the national hymn would be an act of healing, bringing our country closer together. https://t.co/GY51N96j4B

Join @SpeakerPelosi, @SteveScalise, @RepBeatty, @RepTomRice, family of former S.C. Representative Joseph H. Rainey and me as we designate Room H-150 of the U.S. Capitol as "The Joseph H. Rainey Room.” https://t.co/JPZVAzkMPW

While the Senate refuses to act on the House-passed #HR8 and my bill, HR 1446, to close the deadly #CharlestonLoophole, we lose over 110 Americans per day to gun violence.

Survivors deserve more than our "thoughts and prayers."

They deserve our action. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/YV67eFCURj

Thank you to Gonzaga High School for inviting me to speak at your #BlackHistoryMonth assembly.

This month & every month, it's important to celebrate and learn about the Black historical figures that helped make our country great. I enjoyed sharing some of that history with you. https://t.co/wSwj69BnjN

I first met John Lewis in 1960, when we formed SNCC. It's impossible to overstate what he meant to me, this country, and the movement.

I'm proud help honor his legacy by supporting #HR5577 to rename the Atlanta main post office the John R. Lewis Post Office. https://t.co/OOUNfa0LPR

As we strive to agree on a reconciliation bill, we should prioritize policies like closing the coverage gap and extending a modified expanded Child Tax Credit that contribute greatly to making America’s greatness accessible and affordable to more Americans.

Based on my 10-20-30 formula, the Targeting Resources to Communities in Need Act of 2022 will ensure resources from programs across the federal government reach the communities that need them the most.

Read more ⬇️
https://t.co/pWATDWtjit

Poverty is a scourge in a wide range of communities across the country.

That's why today, I introduced legislation with @RepHalRogers, @SenBooker and @SenRobPortman to better direct federal funding to persistent poverty areas nationwide.

As we begin Black History Month, we are reminded of the achievements of African Americans throughout history.

I am pleased to join in this month-long celebration of this rich history and the sacrifices made by so many in the Black community. https://t.co/QT3WzBkgKJ

Much has changed since the first #SocialSecuity check went out 82 years ago, but one thing has not: the program’s benefits remain a critical lifeline helping millions of Americans make ends meet.

I'm proud to support @RepJohnLarson's Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act. https://t.co/fJlUO6ofDm

A record-breaking 14.5 million Americans signed up for health care coverage this open enrollment season.

We must build on this great progress by closing the Medicaid coverage gap to make health care accessible and affordable for even more Americans.
https://t.co/TvHS5yY0LP

Nominating Judge J. Michelle Childs to #SCOTUS says to every little child out there — growing up under moderate circumstances…going to public schools…it says to them, “You’ve got just as much of a chance to benefit from the greatness of this country as everybody else.” https://t.co/wjAmg2XZQe

Good news: The Infrastructure Law will provide $17 billion for hundreds of projects to repair our ports, harbors and inland waterways, including over $12.2 million for 4 SC projects.
 
This critical funding will strengthen our water infrastructure and create good-paying jobs. https://t.co/3M7ns5yMzh

No one ought to have to choose between keeping their family warm & putting food on the table.
 
The $80.2 million in #AmericanRescuePlan funds headed to SC for the Low Income Energy Home Assistance Program will make a huge difference in the lives of working families in our state. https://t.co/P8SHayQYo8

For 28 years, Justice Stephen Breyer has upheld the Constitution as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court with incredible expertise and grace.

I join the American people in thanking Justice Breyer for his dedicated service and wish him all the best in retirement.

Today's GDP numbers make it clear that the #BuildBackBetter economic recovery plan drawn up by @POTUS is working.
 
From the American Rescue Plan to the Infrastructure Law, Democrats are hard at work building a brighter, more prosperous future for every American. https://t.co/UDfaTtOUz5

On this @NASA Day of Remembrance, I'm thinking of my friend and Lake City, SC native, Ron McNair, who was lost in the 1986 Space Shuttle Challenger explosion.

May we remember those who gave their lives while working to advance our nation's discovery of the universe. https://t.co/hHKf83ALoP

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provides $14.2 billion to transition the Emergency Broadband Benefit to the long-term Affordable Connectivity Program.

This will continue support to help families afford internet service.

See if you're eligible: https://t.co/3UBGAEZD4r

On International Holocaust Remembrance Day, the anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, #WeRemember the 6 million Jews and millions of other victims of the Holocaust, and strengthen our commitment to stamp out anti-Semitism and all forms of hatred and bigotry.
I agree. We must close close the coverage gap to make health care accessible and affordable to millions of Americans in the states that have refused to expand Medicaid. https://t.co/DZqAHWYvUV

The newly drawn electoral maps will determine whether or not Black voters and communities of color can have their voices heard. States like Alabama and Ohio ought to learn the lessons from our sordid history and ensure these maps are drawn fairly. https://t.co/3DvVlZg1Bd

When I came to Congress, I made it my mission to address the water issues in the 6th district. Today’s Winding Woods reach groundbreaking builds on the progress we have made with the Lake Marion Regional Water Agency to expand access to potable water & economic opportunities. https://t.co/jInQ3FMUsT

For 32 years, @RepJimCooper has served the people of Tennessee exceptionally well. He's a trusted voice in Congress whose leadership on the House Armed Services, Oversight & Reform, and Budget Committees have bettered our nation.
 
I wish him the best of luck in his next chapter.

Our military is at its best when those called to serve can do so based on skill, not gender identity.

That's why, 1 year ago today, @POTUS signed an Executive Order to ensure transgender service members can once again serve proudly and openly as their authentic selves. https://t.co/JpNEPHNFRP

Minority & low-income communities bear a disproportionate burden from harmful air pollution. Yet Republicans want to gut vital air protections.
 
I joined 190+ Democratic colleagues on an amicus brief calling on #SCOTUS to save the #CleanAirAct because everyone deserves safe air.

50 years ago today, Shirley Chisholm blazed a trail by being the 1st woman & 1st African American to declare her candidacy for president. I was proud to cast my ballot to support her nomination at the 1972 Democratic Convention.

Join me in honoring her legacy. #ChisholmTrail https://t.co/A32MWTV3YY

As @Sifill_LDF said on the latest episode of my podcast, "Civil rights work is democracy work."

The same laws that make it harder for the Black community to vote today, will come and get you tomorrow.
 
We must protect the fundamental right to vote.
https://t.co/xyHtZhUBkH https://t.co/ps3q6nZx1j

President Biden's judicial nominations have been more diverse than any President in history.

In just one year, he's nominated 8 Black women to the U.S. Court of Appeals. If confirmed, they would double the number of Black women on federal appeals courts.
https://t.co/QftNSoNMco

Honored to give this year’s keynote address at the Dr. MLK, Jr. Community Celebration in Aiken, SC.

Dr. King gave his life in pursuit of a more perfect union. To honor his life, we must commit ourselves to making this country’s greatness accessible and affordable for all. https://t.co/eHIguTPqQ1

As I said on @TheSundayShow, we’re only 25% into the Biden-Harris administration. We still have 75% to go and I would hope Americans can look at the good @POTUS has accomplished, from the Infrastructure Law to the expanded Child Tax Credit, as a sign of the good to come. https://t.co/0bCQwXHMbw

States across the country are unleashing a full scale assault on women's right to choose. 

As we mark the 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade, we must continue to safeguard women's fundamental autonomy over their bodies.

Thanks to the #AmericanRescuePlan, $80.2 million is coming to SC for the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program.

This funding will ensure individuals across SC can stay warm as temperatures continue to drop.

Visit the SCOEO website for assistance. https://t.co/FfD9NpZt7Q

Reliable public transportation connects people to their community, jobs, medical care and more.
 
That’s why I'm proud to announce, thanks to @POTUS and the Democrats, SC will receive $373 million under the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to boost our public transportation system. https://t.co/GRACAgWRBD

Yesterday's Senate vote on the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act may not have been what we hoped for, but we're not giving up. That's why, for the newest episode of the Clyburn Chronicles, I sat down with my friend @Sifill_LDF to discuss the path forward.
https://t.co/bCTUBkJNYG

Saddened to learn of the passing of my fellow S.C. State University alumna & @dstinc1913’s National President & Chair of the National Board of Directors Cheryl A. Hickmon. My thoughts are with her family, loved ones, & members of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. during this time.

I'm particularly proud this funding includes $65 billion to expand access to affordable, high-speed broadband.

It is my mission to connect every community so we can help make America’s greatness accessible and affordable to all.

During @POTUS’ first year in office, @HouseDemocrats helped enact the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act: a historic investment in our nation's outdated infrastructure unlike any our generation has seen before.

Be sure to watch the 11:30 AM @FairGrowthCmte hearing today. I'm testifying on my GI Bill Restoration Act with @RepMoulton.

This bill will ensure descendants of Black WWII veterans receive the benefits their ancestors were unjustly denied.

Tune in ⬇️
https://t.co/U8Mm6bpA3g

In his first year, @POTUS:

✅ Put shots in arms, getting 210 million Americans fully vaccinated
✅ Added 6.4 million jobs
✅ Enacted the historic American Rescue Plan & Bipartisan Infrastructure Package

I commend him for a historic year in the face of unprecedented challenges.

Although the Senate’s inaction is disappointing, this is not the end.

Those of us who are committed to our nation’s pursuit of a more perfect Union will continue to heed John Lewis’ admonition to "stand up, speak out and get in the way" to get voter protections signed into law.

I'm saddened to hear of the passing of fellow SC State University graduate, Rudolph Pyatt Jr.

He was a trailblazer, who became one of the few Black reporters in the South in 1964, then a longtime Washington Post columnist. May he Rest in Peace.
https://t.co/W9MTkRfvJH

Today, @TheBlackCaucus marched to the entry of the Senate floor to call upon them to pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act and send this critical legislation to the President’s desk.

The time is now. https://t.co/5HHNSx0IiS

Testing is key to slowing the spread of COVID-19, and I applaud the Biden-Harris Administration and @USPS for their work to deliver these tests to the American people.
 
Sign up to receive your free, at home rapid tests today. https://t.co/VrYbD2iHN9 https://t.co/ZJ7iXoYx6h

We've amended the filibuster time and time again, including to raise the debt limit, and our country is still standing.

Even if it means waiving the filibuster, the Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act to protect the right to vote.

When I first met John Lewis, we were 19-year-old college students who came together in 1960 to found the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee.

I'm pleased @FaithandPolitic is furthering John’s legacy with this first cohort of the John Robert Lewis Scholars and Fellows. https://t.co/Ztx7pFf8z1

Abe Jenkins was a powerful force in SC politics and a dear friend. His dedication to public service was fueled by his commitment to helping better the lives of those across the state. My thoughts & prayers are with his family during this difficult time. Rest in Power my friend.

In 1963, Dr. King spoke of the “fierce urgency of now.” His words still resonate today.

As I discussed on @NewsNation, we must address the current threat to voting rights now or risk going from a democracy to an autocracy.
https://t.co/CTy4gTu7yb

On this Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day, I urge you to keep in mind the true meaning of this celebration.

This country doesn’t have to be made great again. It is already great.

Our challenge is to make this country’s greatness accessible and affordable to all. https://t.co/jLpVH7eziw

My father use to tell me that the darkest hour of the night was the moment right before dawn. 

Things may look dark now but we need to keep pressing on because I am convinced that the people of good will are going to step up and get voting rights done. https://t.co/u8Mx4jHF2S

History should be our guide when it comes to voting rights. 

The 15th Amendment, which gave Black people the right to vote, was passed with the votes of one party. The argument that unless something is bipartisan, it is not credible, flies in the face of history. https://t.co/I5T0pDf9Yk
You can never go wrong with SC’s Loggerhead Turtle. Thank you, @ratemyskyperoom. https://t.co/DsXn8lIoiB

In Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s “Letter from Birmingham Jail”, he said the people of ill will in our society are making a much better use of time than those of good will.

Voting rights are not a Black and white issue. We all ought to speak up and break our silence. https://t.co/lrhJg6Zc63

Today, on what would have been his 93rd birthday, we celebrate the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

He once said, "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter."

May we never forget those words and stand strong in the face of injustice. https://t.co/rqZtjEbMG6

Having access to affordable, reliable health insurance can save your life. Don't miss this opportunity to visit https://t.co/5ipy3hNFl8 and #GetCovered before tomorrow's January 15th deadline. https://t.co/nwQWdCGLjS

For 6 months, the expanded monthly #ChildTaxCredit helped struggling families make ends meet.

Today, due to the Senate’s inaction on #BuildBackBetter, more than 36 million families are losing this monthly lifeline.

America’s children need the expanded #ChildTaxCredit.

Pleased to announce South Carolina will receive more than $274 million over 5 years to fix bridges that have been in long need of repair.
 
This funding from the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will create good paying jobs and bring SC bridges into the 21st century. https://t.co/EqKUCfhCGN

Congratulations to @AprilDRyan on 25 years of reporting. I’ve known April for years. She is a true professional and an example for aspiring journalists to follow. 

Here’s to many more! https://t.co/8vV5iFAGAC

The Republican pandemic political playbook:

1) Legitimize vaccine hesitancy and misinformation
2) Bash and block @POTUS’s vaccination efforts
3) Blame @POTUS for not ending the pandemic

Stop playing politics with people’s lives. https://t.co/ywkX7Ysqef

Today, as I listened to my colleagues across the aisle raise their opposition to the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act, I knew I had to respond.

So I spoke for nearly an hour about the significance of this vote and the history behind it.
https://t.co/AOxKTYHBnn

Today we must ask ourselves, will we uphold our oath and protect this fragile democracy? Or will we subvert the Constitution and fetter the franchise?

I know where I stand. I refuse to allow our country to move backwards.

Let’s pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. https://t.co/1GtZdv3nof

With tonight's vote, House Democrats took an important step towards passing the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act.

The time for action is now. We must counter the wave of voter suppression laws across the nation & protect this sacred right.

When anybody tells @TheBlackCaucus that legislation cannot have credibility unless it's bipartisan, you’re saying that the 15th Amendment is without credibility.

The Senate must pass the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act & Freedom to Vote Act to protect our democracy. https://t.co/kzuZ8SBXUG

Today, I paid my respects to the great former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid as he lies in state at the U.S. Capitol. 

He was a unique and effective public servant, and our nation was bettered by his leadership. My prayers are with his family and loved ones. https://t.co/ACyQ4IDsaL

Today, @POTUS called on the Senate to stand up & be counted.

The time has come to alter the filibuster to protect against extreme attacks on the most basic constitutional right.

The institution of the filibuster cannot be more important than the institution of democracy itself.
Voter nullification efforts are underway in state legislatures across the country. We must protect the most fundamental right in our democracy: the right to vote in free and fair elections.

It's official: @POTUS has sent Judge J. Michelle Childs' nomination to serve on the US Court of Appeals for the DC Circuit to the Senate.

We will miss her in SC, but I know she will bring honor to this prestigious court. I urge her swift confirmation.
https://t.co/O5jBQIKOCb

CO-07 has been well-served by @RepPerlmutter.

From his leadership on @FSCDems to his dedication to common-sense gun reform, Rep. Perlmutter has bettered the lives of families in his district throughout his 15 years in Congress.

I wish you all the best in retirement.

For the first time in history, a Black woman will be featured on the U.S. quarter.

In celebration of her life and legacy of incredible literary works, today the @USMint released a new quarter featuring Maya Angelou. Thank you to @RepBarbaraLee for your dedication to this effort. https://t.co/FKkEi2B201

Members of Congress take an oath to defend the Constitution from all enemies, foreign AND domestic.

Watch my interview with @FoxNewsSunday on the need to pass voting rights legislation after 1/6, a day that represents the threat of tyranny facing America. https://t.co/7vJDS9CPvT

If the Senate can use the reconciliation process to ensure our nation's full faith & credit can't be filibustered, we ought to have a similar rule for voting rights. The fragile fabric that we call our democracy will unravel if we don't protect the most fundamental right to vote. https://t.co/AgSjdpwvXp

Pleased to announce airports in South Carolina will receive more than $32 million in federal funds thanks to investments outlined in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.

President Biden and the Democrats are delivering #ForthePeople.
https://t.co/KTZS9dNQMh

The President's first year in office has been historic, from enacting once-in-a-generation investments for the American people to guiding our country after a deadly attack on our democracy.

I look forward to welcoming him to the Capitol on March 1 for his first SOTU address.

This month’s jobs report, with a new pandemic-low unemployment rate and over 199,000 jobs added, is proof @POTUS is setting our economy back on track.

Still, working families need our help. We ought to pass #BuildBackBetter and build on our progress.
https://t.co/R5yYjQtOjw

It would be a mistake to look upon January 6, 2021, as a one-off event.

Our democracy is teetering and it is incumbent upon us to demand accountability from those responsible. https://t.co/XHlq7Xkqfd

To dismiss the seriousness of #January6 is to condone the insidiousness of the “Big Lie."

Our best protection against this tyrannical threat is to ensure the most fundamental thread of our democratic fabric holds: the right to vote.
https://t.co/8SITpxezWY

January 6, 2021 will always be known as a day of discredit and disgrace, and a test to see if this generation rises to the occasion and protects the integrity of this Democracy.

It'll take the collective will of all of us to ensure this pursuit of a more perfect union continues. https://t.co/iOyP1JQiPt
